newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Gas blast kills mother and children in Kazakhstan.
newsitem.headline: Gas blast kills mother and children in Kazakhstan.

text.p: Three people were killed and two were injured when a gas explosion ripped through an apartment block near the Chimbulak ski resort in Kazakhstan, an official said on Friday.
"A woman and her two children died when a gas cylinder exploded in their flat," a spokesman for the State Committee for Emergency Situations told Reuters.
Tenants of seven other flats damaged by the powerful blast late on Thursday had been relocated, he said.
The ski resort is about 20 km (12 miles) south of the Kazakh capital Almaty.
Household gas shortages in the energy-rich former Soviet republic have forced people to improvise heating, leading to a host of similar accidents in recent months.
